document.docTitle: Sinocatops ruzickai Wang & Zhou 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Sinocatops gen. nov., an apterous genus of Cholevini (Coleoptera: Leiodidae: Cholevinae) from China, with emphasis on differences with allied Rybinskiella Reitter, 1906

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Sinocatops gen. nov., an apterous genus of Cholevini (Coleoptera: Leiodidae: Cholevinae) from China, with emphasis on differences with allied Rybinskiella Reitter, 1906

Description. Male . EBL: 3.20 mm . Length of different body parts: HL: AL: PL: ELL = 0.54: 1.52: 0.82: 1.75 mm ; width: HW: EW: PW: ELW = 0.71: 0.07: 1.15: 1.21 mm . Proportion of antennomeres from base to tip in µm (length × width): 166 × 72, 145 × 61, 134 × 64, 123 × 63, 112 × 69, 104 × 75, 127 × 90, 84 × 80, 112 × 105, 106 × 107, 186 × 98. (Measurements are mean values based on 5 specimens ).

paragraph.emphasis: Sinocatops Rybinskiella S ruzickai R Sintania bodoana R. magnifica

subSubSection.paragraph: / "’ (= +# /2# (0 2 $# Habitus ( Fig. 1A ; 2A) elongate and rather narrow, regularly convex and sublustrous; well pigmented: mostly dark brown; mouthparts, basal five antennomeres, protarsi, apical parts of meso- and metatarsi, and elytral apex somewhat paler. Dorsum continually clothed with fine, recumbent and sallow pubescence.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Sinocatops ruzickai
sp. nov. :
habitus (dorsal view): A , ♂; B , ♀. Scales: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head wider than long, HW/HL = 1.31. Surface covered with large, coarse and sparse punctures, separated about 2.0–4.0 times of their diameter, interspaces smooth. Clypeofrontal suture absent. Clypeus with straight anterior margin. Compound eye built from ca. 62–66 ommatidia, EW/HW = 0.10. Antennae ( Fig. 10A ) long and slender, AL/HW = 2.13; all antennomeres longer than wide at different levels, except 8th and 10th almost as long as wide; 3rd slightly shorter than 2nd; 11th longest, elongated pear-shape. Cervical sclerite with length/width = 1.79 in medial view ( Fig. 4A ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific epithet is dedicated to Dr. Jan Růžička (Czech University of Life Sciences, Prague , Czech Republic ), a famous specialist on Agyrtidae , Silphidae and Leiodidae , for his kind help to our study. Distribution. China ( Sichuan ).
